intro: Ayenia peregrina, commonly known as the wandering ayenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer to early autumn. Ayenia peregrina is typically found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its name reflects its widespread distribution across various regions of South America.
